title: Bondi Beach Shooting Triggers Security Increase At Third Ashes Test In Adelaide | 10 News
description: The Bondi Beach shooting has prompted an unprecedented show of force for the start of the third Ashes test at Adelaide Oval. Police armed with rifles, backed with tougher powers, were conspicuous as tens of thousands of fans filed into the ground. title: Usman Khawaja Recalled For Third Ashes Test After Steve Smith’s Late Withdrawal | 10 News
description: A day after many declared his Test career could be over, Usman Khawaja has taken a shock recall with both hands. He fell just short of a century after Steve Smith withdrew late from the third Ashes Test with vertigo symptoms. title: Alleged Bondi Gunman Charged, Tom Silvagni Sentenced, Sydney Sweeney's New Film | 10 News+
description: The first funerals for the victims of Sunday’s Bondi Beach mass shooting have been held, including for beloved Rabbi Eli Schlanger. New South Wales Premier Chris Minns was in attendance at the service at Chabad of Bondi synagogue, which was overflowing with crowds of mourners.  Former Treasurer Josh Frydenberg has slammed Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, delivering a passionate 50-minute speech at a Bondi Beach vigil in front of mourners and news crews. The former politician, who is Jewish, urged the PM to “take personal responsibility” for Sunday’s mass shooting, saying the government has “failed” the Jewish community. He also offered an 8-point plan of what the Government should do - taking aim at everything from neo-Nazis, the immigration system, Islamic extremism, and pro-Palestine protests.  Tom Silvagni has been sentenced to six years and two months in jail after he was found guilty of rape earlier this month. The non-parole period is three years and three months. In his sentencing remarks, Judge Greg Lyon said Silvagni has not shown remorse for his offending.  US President Donald Trump says an end to the war in Ukraine is “closer than ever”. It comes after Ukraine’s leader Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with US envoy Steve Witkoff and Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner in Berlin, along with a dozen European heads of state. The United States now says a consensus has been reached on 90 per cent of the topics discussed.  In Hollywood, it’s still rare for two women to lead a major studio film. Yet in ‘The Housemaid’, a new thriller based on the 2022 mega-hit book of the same name, actresses Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried share top billing. Both Sweeney and Seyfried have dominated headlines this year for reasons other than their film work. Sweeney copped online criticism over a controversial jeans ad, and Seyfried for her comments on slain conservative commentator Charlie Kirk. Now they’re both soaking up the spotlight as positive early reactions to ‘The Housemaid’ pour in. title: Sydney Sweeney's New Thriller Film | 10 News+
description: In Hollywood, it’s still rare for two women to lead a major studio film. Yet in ‘The Housemaid’, a new thriller based on the 2022 mega-hit book of the same name, actresses Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried share top billing.  Director Paul Feig says he loves "working with great actresses,” and telling female-led stories "in a very three-dimensional way”. title: Donald Trump Says An End To Russia-Ukraine War Is ‘Closer Than Ever’ | 10 News+
description: US President Donald Trump says an end to the war in Ukraine is “closer than ever”. It comes after Ukraine’s leader Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with US envoy Steve Witkoff and Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner in Berlin, along with a dozen European heads of state. The United States now says a consensus has been reached on 90 per cent of the topics discussed. title: Murder And Terrorism Charges Laid Against Alleged Bondi Beach Shooter | 10 News
description: Police have finally laid charges over the Bondi terror attack - in which 15 people were killed.  24-year-old Naveed Akram attended court from his hospital bed tonight. He's alleged to have carried out Sunday's massacre, alongside his father who was shot dead by police. title: Latest On Bondi Shooting Investigation, Trump’s Cabinet Expose, Melbourne Brawl | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – we have the latest on the Bondi Beach shooting after the alleged gunman was charged with 59 offences, including murder and carrying out an act of terror. Donald Trump’s administration is reacting to an explosive article in Vanity Fair in which his chief of staff Susie Wiles says he has “an alcoholic’s personality”, a brawl has broken out at a Melbourne shopping centre, and a community’s fight to keep their 12-metre inflatable Santa. title: CCTV Captures Nick Reiner At Gas Station Before Being Arrested In California | 10 News
description: Newly released security footage shows Nick Reiner visiting a gas station in the hours after murdering his parents in California on Sunday.  The 32-year-old is seen purchasing a drink at a gas station in Los Angeles before leaving and being swarmed by police on the street.  Reiner made his first court appearance on Wednesday for the two murder charges he faces in the stabbing deaths of his parents, filmmaker Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner, who were found dead in their Los Angeles home over the weekend.  The arraignment was delayed until January 7 and Reiner did not enter a plea. title: Dozens Injured After Russian Glide Bomb Attack On Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhia | 10 News
description: At least 29 people, including five children, have been injured after Russian glide bombs struck the southern Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia and nearby areas.  The overnight attack damaged multiple residential buildings, an infrastructure site and an educational facility, regional officials say.  Russia’s President Vladimir Putin has warned Moscow will seek to expand its territorial gains if Ukraine and its allies reject Kremlin demands in peace talks.  The warning comes as US-led diplomatic efforts to end the war continue to stall amid sharply conflicting positions between Kyiv and Moscow.
